text: hello my needle drops Anthony Fantan oh
here I'm a little under the weather
right now but even though I'm cold and
my nose is stuffy I have to put on this
sweater get warm roll up my sleeves and
do an album review of new Belle and
Sebastian LP write about love Belle and
Sebastian is a Scottish band and this is
what I believe to be their eighth LP of
original studio material ensure these
guys are labeled as being an indie pop
group a tweed pop group baroque pop
chamber pop whatever you want to call it
there are a lot of bands that fit into
that genre or style but Belle and
Sebastian more than any other group to
me has always represented the pure sound
of sweetness of soothing innocence music
that if it were a person it would be
just the most the the nicest most
unassuming guy you would ever meet he
doesn't have a bleak outlook on the
world but does admit his problems admits
his faults and feels almost anything can
be resolved with either love or prayer
it's a narrative we've heard the band
play with lyrically again and again and
again and I'm right about love they
round many of the same bases but the
band does make a conscious effort here
and there to not repeat themselves
stylistically on this album like on the
track little Lou ugly jack prophet John
that actually features guest vocals from
Norah Jones which is a collaboration
that on paper in my head seems like
awful terrible but in practice kicks
complete ass I'm not living in the real
world kind of steps outside of Belle and
Sebastian's comfort zone a little bit
because it is so mind-blowing ly upbeat
and not that these guys aren't an upbeat
band but this track is so bright it
really took me off
guard even though I wasn't really
enjoying it all that much another track
I'm not really digging is the title
track the lead single write about love
which actually also relies on a little
bit of star power from actress Carey
Mulligan on vocals and the reason I
didn't really like this track too much
is just that it had this really
cinematic or theatrical narrative to it
that might have fit a lot better on an
album like god help the girl
now despite a couple lows Belle and
Sebastian still write some seriously
great songs on this thing an example for
me is the second track of the album come
on sister which I'm pretty sure from
beginning to end is just made of pure
magic and the song I want the world to
stop is is just as catchy just as a
media and there's some real growers on
this album too like the ghost of rock
school which comes on very easy very
sleepy but has a great groove to it and
as the song progresses it only gets
softer but in that softness that it
grows into it feels like it just gets so
much more distinct so much more defined
it borrows from a lot of 60s garage rock
and has a great groove going for it too
it reminds me a lot of The Velvet
Underground actually if the Velvets had
converted to Christianity and dropped
the drugs and artsy attitude for me the
rest of this album is just filled with a
lot of mad moments that are kind of
created by just my familiarity with
Belle and Sebastian's earlier work and
it's really hard not to compare this new
album with the older stuff
simply because balance of Bastion as a
band are roughly shooting for the same
target that they have been for over 10
years as far as this type of music goes
a brand of pop that takes its coffee
with a lot of cream and a lot of sugar
Belle and Sebastian is still going to be
your number one destination for this
year the band is an established name
when it comes to this stuff if you want
more of the same than head right here
because these guys know how to spin this
yarn they've had years and years of
practice I'm feeling a weak
week week six on this thing maybe a
strong five however I still see this LP
as a possible entry point for somebody
who has never heard of Belle and
Sebastian before and may be interested
in checking out their music getting
acquainted with it what do you guys feel
about this album is it the best thing
Belle and Sebastian has come out with is
it a decent follow up to 2006 is the
life pursuit and what did you think of
god help the girl and also what's your
favorite Belle and Sebastian album and
favorite track from this LP alright guys
you know any Fantana Belle and Sebastian
write about love forever
you
you
